Text: A worthwhile question, Bill. The Stonewall Jackson & Robert E. Lee spoke out against slavery but fought for Virginia because he felt that Virginia was his greatest duty. The same is true for Stonewall Jackson. Both were against slavery. Both felt their greatest duty in life was to Virginia. It's not as simple as Lee statue = racist.
I agree with the message, but this statue of Stonewall Jackson has to go!

There has been a serious discussion of what to with the statues on Monument Ave. Not only Robt E Lee also JEB Stuart, Jeff Davis, Stonewall Jackson. All on Monument Ave. One statue will remain. Arthur Ashe is at the end of the street.

As Virginia’s governor removes some Confederate statues in Richmond, and Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear wants to remove a statue of Jefferson Davis from the Capitol Rotunda, some want the statue of Stonewall Jackson removed from the West Virginia capitol grounds.
